<rule xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset" id="maven-javax-to-jakarta-00005">
            <when>
                <filecontent filename="pom.xml" pattern="artifactId>javax.{renamed-a}-api<"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                    <hint category-id="potential" effort="1" title="javax.{renamed-a} javax.{renamed-a}-api artifactId has been replaced by jakarta.{renamed-a} jakarta.{renamed-a}-api">
                          <message>If you migrate your application to JBoss EAP 7.3, or later, and want to ensure its Maven building, running or testing works as expected, use instead the Jakarta EE dependency with groupId `jakarta.{renamed-a}`, and artifactId `jakarta.{renamed-a}-api`.</message>
                          <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/7.3/html-single/migration_guide/index#maven-artifact-changes-for-jakarta-ee_default" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP 7.3 Migration Guide: Maven Artifact Changes for Jakarta EE"/>
                          <tag>JakartaEE</tag>
                        <quickfix name="javax-to-jakarta-pom-dependencies-a" type="REPLACE">
                               <replacement>jakarta</replacement>
                               <search>javax</search>
                        </quickfix>
                    </hint>
            </perform>
            <where param="renamed-a">
                <matches pattern="(json|json.bind|persistence|security.enterprise)"/>
            </where>
        </rule>
